metadata.description: Primary Azure region for resources
Resource name prefix
Tags to apply to all resources
Custom domain name for the application
Log Analytics workspace name
Location for resources
Resource tags

metadata.name: Log Analytics Workspaces
metadata.description: This module deploys a Log Analytics Workspace.
Optional. The name of diagnostic setting.
Optional. Name of a Diagnostic Log category for a resource type this setting is applied to. Set the specific logs to collect here.
Optional. Name of a Diagnostic Log category group for a resource type this setting is applied to. Set to `allLogs` to collect all logs.
Optional. Enable or disable the category explicitly. Default is `true`.
Optional. The name of logs that will be streamed. "allLogs" includes all possible logs for the resource. Set to `[]` to disable log collection.
Required. Name of a Diagnostic Metric category for a resource type this setting is applied to. Set to `AllMetrics` to collect all metrics.
Optional. Enable or disable the category explicitly. Default is `true`.
Optional. The name of metrics that will be streamed. "allMetrics" includes all possible metrics for the resource. Set to `[]` to disable metric collection.
Optional. A string indicating whether the export to Log Analytics should use the default destination type, i.e. AzureDiagnostics, or use a destination type.
Optional. Instead of using an external reference, use the deployed instance as the target for its diagnostic settings. If set to `true`, the `workspaceResourceId` property is ignored.

Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic log analytics workspace. For security reasons, it is recommended to set diagnostic settings to send data to either storage account, log analytics workspace or event hub.

Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic storage account. For security reasons, it is recommended to set diagnostic settings to send data to either storage account, log analytics workspace or event hub.
Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic event hub authorization rule for the Event Hubs namespace in which the event hub should be created or streamed to.

Optional. Name of the diagnostic event hub within the namespace to which logs are streamed. Without this, an event hub is created for each log category. For security reasons, it is recommended to set diagnostic settings to send data to either storage account, log analytics workspace or event hub.
Optional. The full ARM resource ID of the Marketplace resource to which you would like to send Diagnostic Logs.

Required. Name of the solution.
For solutions authored by Microsoft, the name must be in the pattern: `SolutionType(WorkspaceName)`, for example: `AntiMalware(contoso-Logs)`.
For solutions authored by third parties, the name should be in the pattern: `SolutionType[WorkspaceName]`, for example `MySolution[contoso-Logs]`.
The solution type is case-sensitive.
Required. Plan for solution object supported by the OperationsManagement resource provider.
Properties of the gallery solutions to be created in the log analytics workspace.
Required. Resource ID of the storage account to be linked.
Optional. The names of the blob containers that the workspace should read.
Optional. List of tables to be read by the workspace.
Properties of the storage insights configuration.
Required. Name of the linked service.
Optional. The resource id of the resource that will be linked to the workspace. This should be used for linking resources which require read access.
Optional. The resource id of the resource that will be linked to the workspace. This should be used for linking resources which require write access.
Properties of the linked service.
Required. Name of the link.
Required. Linked storage accounts resources Ids.
Properties of the linked storage account.
Required. Name of the saved search.
Optional. The ETag of the saved search. To override an existing saved search, use "*" or specify the current Etag.
Required. The category of the saved search. This helps the user to find a saved search faster.
Required. Display name for the search.
Optional. The function alias if query serves as a function.

Optional. The optional function parameters if query serves as a function. Value should be in the following format: 'param-name1:type1 = default_value1, param-name2:type2 = default_value2'. For more examples and proper syntax please refer to /azure/kusto/query/functions/user-defined-functions.
Required. The query expression for the saved search.
Optional. The tags attached to the saved search.
Optional. The version number of the query language. The current version is 2 and is the default.
Properties of the saved search.
Required. Name of the data export.
Optional. The destination of the data export.
Optional. Enable or disable the data export.
Required. The list of table names to export.
Properties of the data export.
Required. Name of the data source.
Required. The kind of data source.
Optional. The resource id of the resource that will be linked to the workspace.
Optional. The name of the event log to configure when kind is WindowsEvent.
Optional. The event types to configure when kind is WindowsEvent.
Optional. Name of the object to configure when kind is WindowsPerformanceCounter or LinuxPerformanceObject.
Optional. Name of the instance to configure when kind is WindowsPerformanceCounter or LinuxPerformanceObject.
Optional. Interval in seconds to configure when kind is WindowsPerformanceCounter or LinuxPerformanceObject.
Optional. List of counters to configure when the kind is LinuxPerformanceObject.
Optional. Counter name to configure when kind is WindowsPerformanceCounter.
Optional. State to configure when kind is IISLogs or LinuxSyslogCollection or LinuxPerformanceCollection.
Optional. System log to configure when kind is LinuxSyslog.
Optional. Severities to configure when kind is LinuxSyslog.
Optional. Tags to configure in the resource.
Properties of the data source.
Required. The name of the table.
Optional. The plan for the table.
Optional. The restored logs for the table.
Optional. The schema for the table.
Optional. The search results for the table.
Optional. The retention in days for the table.
Optional. The total retention in days for the table.
Optional. The role assignments for the table.
Properties of the custom table.
Required. The column name.
Required. The column type.
Optional. The column data type logical hint.
Optional. The column description.
Optional. Column display name.
The parameters of the table column.
Required. The destination resource ID.
Optional. Allows to define an Event Hub name. Not applicable when destination is Storage Account.
Optional. The destination metadata.
The data export destination properties.
Optional. Specify the name of lock.
Optional. Specify the type of lock.
An AVM-aligned type for a lock.
Optional. Enables system assigned managed identity on the resource.
Optional. The resource ID(s) to assign to the resource. Required if a user assigned identity is used for encryption.
An AVM-aligned type for a managed identity configuration. To be used if both a system-assigned & user-assigned identities are supported by the resource provider.
Optional. The table to restore data from.
Optional. The timestamp to start the restore from (UTC).
Optional. The timestamp to end the restore by (UTC).
The parameters of the restore operation that initiated the table.
Optional. The name (as GUID) of the role assignment. If not provided, a GUID will be generated.

Required. The role to assign. You can provide either the display name of the role definition, the role definition GUID, or its fully qualified ID in the following format: '/providers/Microsoft.Authorization/roleDefinitions/c2f4ef07-c644-48eb-af81-4b1b4947fb11'.
Required. The principal ID of the principal (user/group/identity) to assign the role to.
Optional. The principal type of the assigned principal ID.
Optional. The description of the role assignment.

Optional. The conditions on the role assignment. This limits the resources it can be assigned to. e.g.: @Resource[Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts/blobServices/containers:ContainerName] StringEqualsIgnoreCase "foo_storage_container".
Optional. Version of the condition.
Optional. The Resource Id of the delegated managed identity resource.
An AVM-aligned type for a role assignment.
Required. The table name.
Required. A list of table custom columns.
Optional. The table description.
Optional. The table display name.
The table schema.
Required. The search job query.
Optional. The search description.
Optional. Limit the search job to return up to specified number of rows.
Optional. The timestamp to start the search from (UTC).
Optional. The timestamp to end the search by (UTC).
The parameters of the search job that initiated the table.

Optional. Name of the solution to be created.
For solutions authored by Microsoft, the name must be in the pattern: `SolutionType(WorkspaceName)`, for example: `AntiMalware(contoso-Logs)`.
For solutions authored by third parties, it can be anything.
The solution type is case-sensitive.
If not provided, the value of the `name` parameter will be used.

Required. The product name of the deployed solution.
For Microsoft published gallery solution it should be `OMSGallery/{solutionType}`, for example `OMSGallery/AntiMalware`.
For a third party solution, it can be anything.
This is case sensitive.
Optional. The publisher name of the deployed solution. For Microsoft published gallery solution, it is `Microsoft`, which is the default value.
Required. Name of the Log Analytics workspace.
Optional. Location for all resources.
Optional. The name of the SKU.
Optional. The capacity reservation level in GB for this workspace, when CapacityReservation sku is selected. Must be in increments of 100 between 100 and 5000.
Optional. List of storage accounts to be read by the workspace.
Optional. List of services to be linked.
Conditional. List of Storage Accounts to be linked. Required if 'forceCmkForQuery' is set to 'true' and 'savedSearches' is not empty.
Optional. Kusto Query Language searches to save.
Optional. LAW data export instances to be deployed.
Optional. LAW data sources to configure.
Optional. LAW custom tables to be deployed.
Optional. List of gallerySolutions to be created in the log analytics workspace.
Optional. Onboard the Log Analytics Workspace to Sentinel. Requires 'SecurityInsights' solution to be in gallerySolutions.
Optional. Number of days data will be retained for.
Optional. The workspace daily quota for ingestion.
Optional. The network access type for accessing Log Analytics ingestion.
Optional. The network access type for accessing Log Analytics query.
Optional. The managed identity definition for this resource. Only one type of identity is supported: system-assigned or user-assigned, but not both.
Optional. Set to 'true' to use resource or workspace permissions and 'false' (or leave empty) to require workspace permissions.
Optional. The diagnostic settings of the service.
Optional. Indicates whether customer managed storage is mandatory for query management.
Optional. The lock settings of the service.
Optional. Array of role assignments to create.
Optional. Tags of the resource.
Optional. Enable/Disable usage telemetry for module.

variables.formattedUserAssignedIdentities: [reduce(map(coalesce(tryGet(parameters('managedIdentities'), 'userAssignedResourceIds'), createArray()), lambda('id', createObject(format('{0}', lambdaVariables('id')), createObject()))), createObject(), lambda('cur', 'next', union(lambdaVariables('cur'), lambdaVariables('next'))))]

properties.notes: [if(equals(tryGet(parameters('lock'), 'kind'), 'CanNotDelete'), 'Cannot delete resource or child resources.', 'Cannot delete or modify the resource or child resources.')]

metadata.name: Log Analytics Workspace Storage Insight Configs
metadata.description: This module deploys a Log Analytics Workspace Storage Insight Config.
Conditional. The name of the parent Log Analytics workspace. Required if the template is used in a standalone deployment.
Optional. The name of the storage insights config.
Required. The Azure Resource Manager ID of the storage account resource.
Optional. The names of the blob containers that the workspace should read.
Optional. The names of the Azure tables that the workspace should read.
Optional. Tags to configure in the resource.
The resource ID of the deployed storage insights configuration.
The resource group where the storage insight configuration is deployed.
The name of the storage insights configuration.

metadata.name: Log Analytics Workspace Linked Services
metadata.description: This module deploys a Log Analytics Workspace Linked Service.
Conditional. The name of the parent Log Analytics workspace. Required if the template is used in a standalone deployment.
Required. Name of the link.
Optional. The resource ID of the resource that will be linked to the workspace. This should be used for linking resources which require read access.
Optional. The resource ID of the resource that will be linked to the workspace. This should be used for linking resources which require write access.
Optional. Tags to configure in the resource.
The name of the deployed linked service.
The resource ID of the deployed linked service.
The resource group where the linked service is deployed.

metadata.name: Log Analytics Workspace Linked Storage Accounts
metadata.description: This module deploys a Log Analytics Workspace Linked Storage Account.
Conditional. The name of the parent Log Analytics workspace. Required if the template is used in a standalone deployment.
Required. Name of the link.
Required. Linked storage accounts resources Ids.
The name of the deployed linked storage account.
The resource ID of the deployed linked storage account.
The resource group where the linked storage account is deployed.

Required. Name of the saved search.
Required. Display name for the search.
Required. Query category.
Required. Kusto Query to be stored.

Optional. The optional function parameters if query serves as a function. Value should be in the following format: "param-name1:type1 = default_value1, param-name2:type2 = default_value2". For more examples and proper syntax please refer to /azure/kusto/query/functions/user-defined-functions.
Optional. The version number of the query language.
Optional. The ETag of the saved search. To override an existing saved search, use "*" or specify the current Etag.

metadata.name: Log Analytics Workspace Data Exports
metadata.description: This module deploys a Log Analytics Workspace Data Export.
Required. The destination resource ID.

Optional. The destination metadata.
The data export destination properties.
Required. The data export rule name.

Optional. Active when enabled.

The name of the data export.

metadata.name: Operations Management Solutions
metadata.description: This module deploys an Operations Management Solution.

Optional. Name of the solution to be created.
For solutions authored by Microsoft, the name must be in the pattern: `SolutionType(WorkspaceName)`, for example: `AntiMalware(contoso-Logs)`.
For solutions authored by third parties, it can be anything.
The solution type is case-sensitive.
If not provided, the value of the `name` parameter will be used.

Required. The product name of the deployed solution.
For Microsoft published gallery solution it should be `OMSGallery/{solutionType}`, for example `OMSGallery/AntiMalware`.
For a third party solution, it can be anything.
This is case sensitive.
Optional. The publisher name of the deployed solution. For Microsoft published gallery solution, it is `Microsoft`, which is the default value.

Required. Name of the solution.
For solutions authored by Microsoft, the name must be in the pattern: `SolutionType(WorkspaceName)`, for example: `AntiMalware(contoso-Logs)`.
For solutions authored by third parties, the name should be in the pattern: `SolutionType[WorkspaceName]`, for example `MySolution[contoso-Logs]`.
The solution type is case-sensitive.
Required. Plan for solution object supported by the OperationsManagement resource provider.
Required. Name of the Log Analytics workspace where the solution will be deployed/enabled.
Optional. Location for all resources.
Optional. Enable/Disable usage telemetry for module.
The name of the deployed solution.
The resource ID of the deployed solution.
The resource group where the solution is deployed.
The location the resource was deployed into.
The resource ID of the deployed log analytics workspace.
The resource group of the deployed log analytics workspace.
The name of the deployed log analytics workspace.
The ID associated with the workspace.
The location the resource was deployed into.
The principal ID of the system assigned identity.
Container Registry name
Location for resources
Resource tags
Log Analytics workspace resource ID
Subnet ID for private endpoint (optional for shared ACR)

parameters.privateEndpoints: [if(empty(parameters('subnetId')), createObject('value', createArray()), createObject('value', createArray(createObject('name', format('{0}-pe', parameters('name')), 'subnetResourceId', parameters('subnetId'), 'service', 'registry'))))]

metadata.name: Azure Container Registries (ACR)
metadata.description: This module deploys an Azure Container Registry (ACR).
The name of the private endpoint.
The resource ID of the private endpoint.
The group Id for the private endpoint Group.
FQDN that resolves to private endpoint IP address.
A list of private IP addresses of the private endpoint.
The custom DNS configurations of the private endpoint.
The IDs of the network interfaces associated with the private endpoint.
Optional. The name of the scope map.
Required. The list of scoped permissions for registry artifacts.
Optional. The user friendly description of the scope map.
Optional. FQDN that resolves to private endpoint IP address.
Required. A list of private IP addresses of the private endpoint.
Required. The name of the resource that is unique within a resource group.
Required. The ID of a group obtained from the remote resource that this private endpoint should connect to.
Required. The member name of a group obtained from the remote resource that this private endpoint should connect to.
Required. A private IP address obtained from the private endpoint's subnet.
Required. Properties of private endpoint IP configurations.
Optional. The name of the Private DNS Zone Group.
Optional. The name of the private DNS Zone Group config.
Required. The resource id of the private DNS zone.
Required. The private DNS Zone Groups to associate the Private Endpoint. A DNS Zone Group can support up to 5 DNS zones.
Required. The resource ID of a key vault to reference a customer managed key for encryption from.
Required. The name of the customer managed key to use for encryption.
Optional. The version of the customer managed key to reference for encryption. If not provided, using version as per 'autoRotationEnabled' setting.
Optional. Enable or disable auto-rotating to the latest key version. Default is `true`. If set to `false`, the latest key version at the time of the deployment is used.
Optional. User assigned identity to use when fetching the customer managed key. Required if no system assigned identity is available for use.
An AVM-aligned type for a customer-managed key. To be used if the resource type supports auto-rotation of the customer-managed key.
Optional. The name of the diagnostic setting.
Optional. Name of a Diagnostic Log category for a resource type this setting is applied to. Set the specific logs to collect here.
Optional. Name of a Diagnostic Log category group for a resource type this setting is applied to. Set to `allLogs` to collect all logs.
Optional. Enable or disable the category explicitly. Default is `true`.
Optional. The name of logs that will be streamed. "allLogs" includes all possible logs for the resource. Set to `[]` to disable log collection.
Required. Name of a Diagnostic Metric category for a resource type this setting is applied to. Set to `AllMetrics` to collect all metrics.
Optional. Enable or disable the category explicitly. Default is `true`.
Optional. The name of metrics that will be streamed. "allMetrics" includes all possible metrics for the resource. Set to `[]` to disable metric collection.
Optional. A string indicating whether the export to Log Analytics should use the default destination type, i.e. AzureDiagnostics, or use a destination type.

Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic log analytics workspace. For security reasons, it is recommended to set diagnostic settings to send data to either storage account, log analytics workspace or event hub.

Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic storage account. For security reasons, it is recommended to set diagnostic settings to send data to either storage account, log analytics workspace or event hub.
Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic event hub authorization rule for the Event Hubs namespace in which the event hub should be created or streamed to.

Optional. Name of the diagnostic event hub within the namespace to which logs are streamed. Without this, an event hub is created for each log category. For security reasons, it is recommended to set diagnostic settings to send data to either storage account, log analytics workspace or event hub.
Optional. The full ARM resource ID of the Marketplace resource to which you would like to send Diagnostic Logs.
An AVM-aligned type for a diagnostic setting. To be used if both logs & metrics are supported by the resource provider.
Optional. Specify the name of lock.
Optional. Specify the type of lock.
An AVM-aligned type for a lock.
Optional. Enables system assigned managed identity on the resource.
Optional. The resource ID(s) to assign to the resource. Required if a user assigned identity is used for encryption.
An AVM-aligned type for a managed identity configuration. To be used if both a system-assigned & user-assigned identities are supported by the resource provider.
Optional. The name of the Private Endpoint.
Optional. The location to deploy the Private Endpoint to.
Optional. The name of the private link connection to create.
Optional. The subresource to deploy the Private Endpoint for. For example "vault" for a Key Vault Private Endpoint.
Required. Resource ID of the subnet where the endpoint needs to be created.
Optional. The resource ID of the Resource Group the Private Endpoint will be created in. If not specified, the Resource Group of the provided Virtual Network Subnet is used.
Optional. The private DNS Zone Group to configure for the Private Endpoint.
Optional. If Manual Private Link Connection is required.
Optional. A message passed to the owner of the remote resource with the manual connection request.
Optional. Custom DNS configurations.
Optional. A list of IP configurations of the Private Endpoint. This will be used to map to the first-party Service endpoints.
Optional. Application security groups in which the Private Endpoint IP configuration is included.
Optional. The custom name of the network interface attached to the Private Endpoint.
Optional. Specify the type of lock.
Optional. Array of role assignments to create.
Optional. Tags to be applied on all resources/Resource Groups in this deployment.
Optional. Enable/Disable usage telemetry for module.

An AVM-aligned type for a private endpoint. To be used if the private endpoint's default service / groupId can be assumed (i.e., for services that only have one Private Endpoint type like 'vault' for key vault).
Optional. The name (as GUID) of the role assignment. If not provided, a GUID will be generated.

Required. The role to assign. You can provide either the display name of the role definition, the role definition GUID, or its fully qualified ID in the following format: '/providers/Microsoft.Authorization/roleDefinitions/c2f4ef07-c644-48eb-af81-4b1b4947fb11'.
Required. The principal ID of the principal (user/group/identity) to assign the role to.
Optional. The principal type of the assigned principal ID.
Optional. The description of the role assignment.

Optional. The conditions on the role assignment. This limits the resources it can be assigned to. e.g.: @Resource[Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts/blobServices/containers:ContainerName] StringEqualsIgnoreCase "foo_storage_container".
Optional. Version of the condition.
Optional. The Resource Id of the delegated managed identity resource.
An AVM-aligned type for a role assignment.
Required. Name of your Azure Container Registry.
Optional. Enable admin user that have push / pull permission to the registry.
Optional. Location for all resources.
Optional. Array of role assignments to create.
Optional. Tier of your Azure container registry.
Optional. The value that indicates whether the export policy is enabled or not.
Optional. The value that indicates whether the quarantine policy is enabled or not. Note, requires the 'acrSku' to be 'Premium'.
Optional. The value that indicates whether the trust policy is enabled or not. Note, requires the 'acrSku' to be 'Premium'.
Optional. The value that indicates whether the retention policy is enabled or not.
Optional. The number of days to retain an untagged manifest after which it gets purged.
Optional. The value that indicates whether the policy for using ARM audience token for a container registr is enabled or not. Default is enabled.
Optional. Soft Delete policy status. Default is disabled.
Optional. The number of days after which a soft-deleted item is permanently deleted.
Optional. Enable a single data endpoint per region for serving data. Not relevant in case of disabled public access. Note, requires the 'acrSku' to be 'Premium'.

Optional. Whether or not public network access is allowed for this resource. For security reasons it should be disabled. If not specified, it will be disabled by default if private endpoints are set and networkRuleSetIpRules are not set.  Note, requires the 'acrSku' to be 'Premium'.
Optional. Whether to allow trusted Azure services to access a network restricted registry.
Optional. The default action of allow or deny when no other rules match.
Optional. The IP ACL rules. Note, requires the 'acrSku' to be 'Premium'.
Optional. Configuration details for private endpoints. For security reasons, it is recommended to use private endpoints whenever possible. Note, requires the 'acrSku' to be 'Premium'.
Optional. Whether or not zone redundancy is enabled for this container registry.
Optional. All replications to create.
Optional. All webhooks to create.
Optional. The lock settings of the service.
Optional. The managed identity definition for this resource.
Optional. Tags of the resource.
Optional. Enable/Disable usage telemetry for module.
Optional. The diagnostic settings of the service.
Optional. Enables registry-wide pull from unauthenticated clients. It's in preview and available in the Standard and Premium service tiers.
Optional. The customer managed key definition.
Optional. Array of Cache Rules.
Optional. Array of Credential Sets.
Optional. Scope maps setting.

variables.formattedUserAssignedIdentities: [reduce(map(coalesce(tryGet(parameters('managedIdentities'), 'userAssignedResourceIds'), createArray()), lambda('id', createObject(format('{0}', lambdaVariables('id')), createObject()))), createObject(), lambda('cur', 'next', union(lambdaVariables('cur'), lambdaVariables('next'))))]
variables.identity: [if(not(empty(parameters('managedIdentities'))), createObject('type', if(coalesce(tryGet(parameters('managedIdentities'), 'systemAssigned'), false()), if(not(empty(coalesce(tryGet(parameters('managedIdentities'), 'userAssignedResourceIds'), createObject()))), 'SystemAssigned, UserAssigned', 'SystemAssigned'), if(not(empty(coalesce(tryGet(parameters('managedIdentities'), 'userAssignedResourceIds'), createObject()))), 'UserAssigned', 'None')), 'userAssignedIdentities', if(not(empty(variables('formattedUserAssignedIdentities'))), variables('formattedUserAssignedIdentities'), null())), null())]

properties.encryption: [if(not(empty(parameters('customerManagedKey'))), createObject('status', 'enabled', 'keyVaultProperties', createObject('identity', if(not(empty(coalesce(tryGet(parameters('customerManagedKey'), 'userAssignedIdentityResourceId'), ''))), reference('cMKUserAssignedIdentity').clientId, null()), 'keyIdentifier', if(not(empty(tryGet(parameters('customerManagedKey'), 'keyVersion'))), format('{0}/{1}', reference('cMKKeyVault::cMKKey').keyUri, parameters('customerManagedKey').keyVersion), if(coalesce(tryGet(parameters('customerManagedKey'), 'autoRotationEnabled'), true()), reference('cMKKeyVault::cMKKey').keyUri, reference('cMKKeyVault::cMKKey').keyUriWithVersion)))), null())]

properties.notes: [if(equals(tryGet(parameters('lock'), 'kind'), 'CanNotDelete'), 'Cannot delete resource or child resources.', 'Cannot delete or modify the resource or child resources.')]

metadata.name: Container Registries scopeMaps
metadata.description: This module deploys an Azure Container Registry (ACR) scopeMap.
Conditional. The name of the parent registry. Required if the template is used in a standalone deployment.
Optional. The name of the scope map.
Required. The list of scoped permissions for registry artifacts.
Optional. The user friendly description of the scope map.

metadata.name: Communication Services
metadata.description: This module deploys a Communication Service
Optional. The name of the diagnostic setting.
Optional. Name of a Diagnostic Log category for a resource type this setting is applied to. Set the specific logs to collect here.

Optional. Enable or disable the category explicitly. Default is `true`.
Optional. The name of logs that will be streamed. "allLogs" includes all possible logs for the resource. Set to `[]` to disable log collection.

Optional. Enable or disable the category explicitly. Default is `true`.
Optional. The name of metrics that will be streamed. "allMetrics" includes all possible metrics for the resource. Set to `[]` to disable metric collection.
Optional. A string indicating whether the export to Log Analytics should use the default destination type, i.e. AzureDiagnostics, or use a destination type.

Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic log analytics workspace. For security reasons, it is recommended to set diagnostic settings to send data to either storage account, log analytics workspace or event hub.

Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic event hub authorization rule for the Event Hubs namespace in which the event hub should be created or streamed to.

Optional. Name of the diagnostic event hub within the namespace to which logs are streamed. Without this, an event hub is created for each log category. For security reasons, it is recommended to set diagnostic settings to send data to either storage account, log analytics workspace or event hub.

metadata.description: This module deploys a Public DNS Zone CNAME record.
Optional. The name (as GUID) of the role assignment. If not provided, a GUID will be generated.

Required. The role to assign. You can provide either the display name of the role definition, the role definition GUID, or its fully qualified ID in the following format: '/providers/Microsoft.Authorization/roleDefinitions/c2f4ef07-c644-48eb-af81-4b1b4947fb11'.
Required. The principal ID of the principal (user/group/identity) to assign the role to.
Optional. The principal type of the assigned principal ID.
Optional. The description of the role assignment.

Optional. The conditions on the role assignment. This limits the resources it can be assigned to. e.g.: @Resource[Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts/blobServices/containers:ContainerName] StringEqualsIgnoreCase "foo_storage_container".
Optional. Version of the condition.
Optional. The Resource Id of the delegated managed identity resource.
An AVM-aligned type for a role assignment.
Conditional. The name of the parent DNS zone. Required if the template is used in a standalone deployment.
Required. The name of the CNAME record.
Optional. A CNAME record. Cannot be used in conjuction with the "targetResource" property.
Optional. The metadata attached to the record set.
Optional. The TTL (time-to-live) of the records in the record set.

Optional. A reference to an azure resource from where the dns resource value is taken. Also known as an alias record sets and are only supported for record types A, AAAA and CNAME. A resource ID can be an Azure Traffic Manager, Azure CDN, Front Door, Static Web App, or a resource ID of a record set of the same type in the DNS zone (i.e. A, AAAA or CNAME). Cannot be used in conjuction with the "aRecords" property.
Optional. Array of role assignments to create.
The name of the deployed CNAME record.
The resource ID of the deployed CNAME record.
The resource group of the deployed CNAME record.

Optional. The conditions on the role assignment. This limits the resources it can be assigned to. e.g.: @Resource[Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts/blobServices/containers:ContainerName] StringEqualsIgnoreCase "foo_storage_container".
Optional. Version of the condition.
Optional. The Resource Id of the delegated managed identity resource.
An AVM-aligned type for a role assignment.
Conditional. The name of the parent DNS zone. Required if the template is used in a standalone deployment.
Required. The name of the CAA record.
Optional. The metadata attached to the record set.
Optional. The list of CAA records in the record set.
Optional. The TTL (time-to-live) of the records in the record set.
Optional. Array of role assignments to create.
The name of the deployed CAA record.
The resource ID of the deployed CAA record.
The resource group of the deployed CAA record.
